original_content:
Are there any cookies that taste better than the ones you make yourself? Well, maybe, but theres a certain exquisite flavoring to effort. Just ask [jformulate], who created these custom chocolate-topped butter cookies using a mixture of 3D printing, silicone, and of course, baking and tempering.
[jformulate] did this project along with a makerspace group, and the first thing they did was decide on some images for the cookies. Once a hexagon-shaped mold was created in Fusion360, the images were added in. Some had to be height-adjusted in order for the detail to come out.
Once these positives were printed, it was time to make the food-safe silicone molds that would form the custom chocolate toppers. If you dont have a vacuum de-gasser, [jformulate] recommends pouring a thin stream from a high place to avoid air bubbles. You can always tap the mold several times on a flat surface as well to bring trapped air to the top.
Finally, its time to make cookies. [jformulate] has good instructions for tempering chocolate, as well as a recipe for the butter cookies that support the designs. As a bonus, [jformulate] shows how to make a fish-shaped hot chocolate bomb, and made Jolly Rancher (sadly not Wrencher) medallions using the silicone molds and a microwave.
For the semi-disappointed, directly 3D printing cookies is definitely a thing.
title: 3Dプリンティングとシリコンを使ったカスタムチョコレートトップのクッキーの作り方
body: 個人の努力には独特の魅力があります。[jformulate]さんは3Dプリンティング、シリコン、焼きや調整を使用して特製チョコレートトップのバタークッキーを作成しました。プロジェクトでは、画像がクッキーに追加され、シリコン型が作られました。
titles: 3Dプリンティングとシリコンを使ったカスタムチョコレートトップのクッキーの作り方
メーカースペースのグループと一緒に作る、ユニークなデザインのバタークッキー
チョコレートトップのクッキーに使う食品安全なシリコンモールドの作り方
3Dプリンティングでクッキーを直接作る方法
バタークッキーのレシピとテンパリングチョコレートのコツを紹介
